alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 6:59PM MST until July 25 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Portions of Coconino County south of Tuba City in north central Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 657 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain south of Tuba City and northeast of Cameron. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Moenave, Hopi. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 312 and 318. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 471 and 486. State Route 264 between mile markers 329 and 332. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tonahakaad Spring, Hamblin Wash, Paiute Trail Wash, Little Colorado River, Moenkopi Wash, Dinnebito Wash, Fivemile Wash and Landmark Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
